Source.Name: perl-test-nowarnings
Source.Summary: Test::NoWarnings - Make sure you didn't emit any warnings while testing
Source.Description: In general, your tests shouldn't produce warnings. This modules causes any warnings to be captured and stored. It automatically adds an extra test that will run when your script ends to check that there were no warnings. If there were any warings, the test will give a "not ok" and diagnostics of where, when and what the warning was, including a stack trace of what was going on when the it occurred.
